creator: circuits
title: TMP36 Temperature Sensor With Arduino in Tinkercad
description: This project turns an Arduino into a thermometer. It uses a TMP36 temperature sensor to measure temperature and displays the output using three LEDs as a bar graph.
steps: Wire up the Arduino and breadboard with power and ground.
Add three LEDs to the breadboard, spaced two sockets apart.
Connect each LED's cathode to the ground rail of the breadboard using a 220 Ohm resistor.
Connect the LED anodes to digital pins 4, 3, and 2 on the Arduino.
Place the temperature sensor (TMP36) on the breadboard.
Wire up the temperature sensor so the left pin connects to the 5V voltage rail, the center pin connects to A0 on the Arduino, and the right pin connects to the GND rail.
Open the Code Editor and find the "Serial Monitor" button to watch the sensor values.
Create variables in the code to store the baseline temperature and the Celsius temperature.
Use a "map" block to convert the analog input from the temperature sensor to a Celsius value.
Optionally create a variable to convert Celsius to Fahrenheit.
Add serial monitoring blocks to print the temperature in Celsius and/or Fahrenheit.
Use if statements to determine which LEDs to light up based on the Celsius temperature.
Calibrate the sensor by adjusting the baseline temperature and temperature threshold ranges.
